column6: Critically Endangered (80 percent certain, based on the evidence available)
column10: Kerek used to be classified as a dialect of Chukchee, but it has idiosyncratic features suggesting, on the one hand, a non-Chukchee-Koryak (probably Eskimo-Aleut) substrate, and, on the other hand, transitionality towards Koryak; the superficial similarity of Kerek with Chukchee can also be due to secondary Chukchee areal influence on Kerek.

column5: Orochi; орочский язык; Sprache der Oročonen; Oroć;

column10: Former language of the village of Sireniki and several smaller villages to the west of Sireniki along the south-eastern coast of Chukotka.
column11: Sirenikski represents a third branch of the Eskimo language family, coordinate to Yupik and Inuit.
